Bounds.!doc: Widget bounds are represented as an object with the following properties:

left.!doc: The horizontal offset from the parent's left edge in dip

top.!doc: The horizontal offset from the parent's top edge in dip

width.!doc: The width of the widget in dip

height.!doc: The height of the widget in dip

Color.!doc: Colors are specified as strings using one of the following formats:

Font.!doc: Fonts are specified as strings using the shorthand syntax known from CSS. The font family may be omitted, in this case the default system font will be used.

Image.!doc: Image object associated with the element.

width.!doc: Image width, extracted from the image file when missing.

height.!doc: Image height, extracted from the image file when missing.

scale.!doc: Image scale factor - the image will be scaled down by this factor. Ignored when width or height are set.

LayoutData.!doc: Used to define how a widget should be arranged within its parent.

left.!doc: The position of the widget's left edge relative to the parent or a sibling widget.

right.!doc: The position of the widget's right edge relative to the parent or a sibling widget.

top.!doc: The position of the widget's top edge relative to the parent or a sibling widget.

bottom.!doc: The position of the widget's bottom edge relative to the parent or a sibling widget.

centerX.!doc: The horizontal position of the widget's center relative to the parent's center.

centerY.!doc: The vertical position of the widget's center relative to the parent's center.

baseline.!doc: The vertical position of the widget's baseline relative to a sibling widget.

Transformation.!doc: Transformations are specified as an object with the following properties:

Selector.!doc: Selectors are used to filter a given list of widgets. It can be function returning a boolean for a given widget. However, more commonly a selector is a string that may either reference a widgets type (e.g. "Button", "TextView"), or its id ("#myButton", "#myTextView").

margin.!doc: Distance to a parent's or sibling's opposing edge in one of these formats: offset, percentage, Widget, "selector", "prev()", "percentage offset", "selector offset", "prev() offset", [Widget, offset], [percentage, offset], [selector, offset], ["prev()", offset]

dimension.!doc: A positive float, or 0, representing device independent pixels.

offset.!doc: A positive or negative float, or 0, representing device independent pixels.

background.!doc: Background color for the navigation elements

textColor.!doc: Text color for the navigation elements

toolbarVisible.!doc: Whether the toolbars above and below pages are visible. Default: "true"

language.!doc: The user language configured on the device as an RFC 4646 compliant string. For example "de", "es-ES", etc. This property is also available globally as navigator.language.

model.!doc: The name of the device model. For example "iPad4,1" or "Nexus 7". This property is also available globally as device.model.

orientation.!doc: The device orientation. One of "portrait-primary", "portrait-secondary", "landscape-primary", and "landscape-secondary".

platform.!doc: The name of the platform. Currently either "Android" or "iOS". This property is also available globally as device.platform.

scaleFactor.!doc: The ratio between physical pixels and device independent pixels. This property is also available globally as "window.devicePixelRatio"

screenHeight.!doc: The entire height of the device's screen in device independent pixel. Depends on the current device orientation. This property is also available globally as screen.height.

screenWidth.!doc: The entire width of the device's screen in device independent pixel. Depends on the current device orientation. This property is also available as globally as screen.width.

version.!doc: The platform version. On iOS it lools like this: "8.1.1". On Android, the version code is returned. This property is also available globally as device.version.

enabled.!doc: Whether the action can be invoked.

placementPriority.!doc: Actions with higher placement priority will be placed at a more significant position in the UI, e.g. low priority actions could go into a menu instead of being included in a toolbar. Supported values: "low", "high", "normal", default: "normal".

title.!doc: The text to be displayed for the action.

class.!doc: A string containing a whitespace separated list of "classes". A class is an arbitrary name for a state or category the widget should be identifiable by. It may only contain alphanumeric characters, "_" and "-".

id.!doc: A string to identify the widget by using selectors. Id's are optional. It is strongly recommended that they are unique within a page.

enabled.!doc: Whether the widget can be operated. Default: "true"

visible.!doc: Whether the widget is visible. Default: "true"

left.!doc: The position of the widget's left edge relative to the parent or a sibling widget.

right.!doc: The position of the widget's right edge relative to the parent or a sibling widget.

top.!doc: The position of the widget's top edge relative to the parent or a sibling widget.

bottom.!doc: The position of the widget's bottom edge relative to the parent or a sibling widget.

centerX.!doc: The horizontal position of the widget's center relative to the parent's center.

centerY.!doc: The vertical position of the widget's center relative to the parent's center.

baseline.!doc: The vertical position of the widget's baseline relative to a sibling widget.

font.!doc: The font used for the widget.

backgroundImage.!doc: An image to be displayed on the widget's background. If the image is smaller than the widget, it will be tiled.

bounds.!doc: The actual location and size of the widget, relative to its parent. This property is read-only.

opacity.!doc: Opacity of the entire widget. Can be used for fade animations. Default: "1".

transform.!doc: Modifications to the widget's shape, size, or position. Can be used for animations. Note: In Android the "transform" property does not affect the "bounds" property, while it does so in iOS.

highlightOnTouch.!doc: Whether the entire widget should be highlighted while touched. Default: "false".

alignment.!doc: The horizontal alignment of the button text. Supported values: "left", "right", "center", default: "center".

image.!doc: An image to be displayed on the button.
An image to be displayed next to the navigation drawer page entry.

topLevel.!doc: Defines whether this is a top level page. Default: "false".

alignment.!doc: The horizontal alignment of the text. Supported values: "left", "right", "center", default: "left".

markupEnabled.!doc:
Allows for a subset of HTML tags in the label text. Supported tags are: "a", "del", "ins", "b", "i", "strong", "em", "big", "small", "br". All tags must be closed (e.g. use
instead of
). Nesting tags is currently not supported. This property must be set in the "create" method. It cannot be changed after widget creation.

maxLines.!doc: Limit the number of lines to be displayed to the given maximum. "null" disables this limit. Default: "null".

alignment.!doc: The horizontal alignment of the text. Supported values: "left", "right", "center", default: "left".

autoCapitalize.!doc: Automatically switch to capital letters after every key pressed. Default: "false".

autoCorrect.!doc: Enables the spell checker and auto-correction feature. Default: "false".

editable.!doc: Specifies whether the TextInput can be edited.

keyboard.!doc: Selects the keyboard type to use for editing this widget. Supported values: "ascii", "decimal", "email", "number", "numbersAndPunctuation", "phone", "url", "default",

message.!doc: A hint text that is displayed when the input field is empty.

text.!doc: The text in the input field.

type.!doc: The type of the text widget. This property can only be set in the "tabris.create" method. It cannot be changed after widget creation. Supported values: "default", "password", "search", "multiline", default: "default".

selection.!doc: The checked state of the check box. Default: "false".

text.!doc: The label text of the check box.

selection.!doc: The checked state of the switch. Default: "false".

thumbOnColor.!doc: The color of the movable thumb, when switched "on".

thumbOffColor.!doc: The color of the movable thumb, when switched "off".

trackOnColor.!doc: The color of the track that holds the thumb, when switched "on".

trackOffColor.!doc: The color of the track that holds the thumb, when switched "off".

initializeCell.!doc: A callback used to initialize a collection cell by attaching widget and "change:item" listener. Cells are created by the framework and recycled on scrolling. This callback receives the cell as the first and the cell type as second parameter.

itemHeight.!doc: The height of a collection cell. If set to a function, this function will be called for every item, providing the item and the cell type as parameters, and must return the item height for the given item.

items.!doc: An array of data items to be displayed by the collection view. For dynamic content, use the methods "insert" and "remove" instead of setting this property directly.

refreshEnabled.!doc: Enables the user to trigger a refresh by using the pull-to-refresh gesture. Default: "false".

refreshIndicator.!doc: Whether the refresh indicator is currently visible. Will be set to "true" when a "refresh" event is triggered. Reset it to "false" when the refresh is finished. Default: "false".

refreshMessage.!doc: The message text displayed together with the refresh indicator. Currently not supported on Android. Default: "".

cellType.!doc: The name of the cell type to use for a given item. This name will be passed to the initializeCell and itemHeight functions. Cells will be reused only by items that require the same cell type. If set to a function, this function will be called for every item, providing the item as a parameter, and must return a name for the cell type to use for the given item.

firstVisibleIndex.!doc: The first item that is currently visible on screen. This property is read-only.

lastVisibleIndex.!doc: The last item that is currently visible on screen. This property is read-only.

items.!doc: An array of data items to be displayed by the picker. If the items aren't strings, the "itemText" property must be set to a function to extract item texts.

itemText.!doc: A function that returns the string to display for a given data item. Defaults to mapping items to their default string representation.

selectionIndex.!doc: The index of the currently selected item.

image.!doc: The image shown in the ImageView.

scaleMode.!doc: The scale mode of the image in the ImageView. Supported values: "auto", "fit", "fill", "stretch", "none", default: "auto"

maximum.!doc: The maximal numeric value of the progress bar, default: "100"

minimum.!doc: The minimal numeric value of the progress bar, default: "0"

selection.!doc: The current progress bar value. Default: "0"

state.!doc: The state of the progress bar. Supported values: "normal", "paused", "error", default: "normal"

selection.!doc: The checked state of the radio button. Default: "false".

text.!doc: The label text of the radio button.

proposals.!doc: The list of proposals to display. Default: "[]".

text.!doc: The text in the search input field.

message.!doc: A hint text that is displayed when the search input is empty.

maximum.!doc: The maximal numeric value of the slider, default: "100"

minimum.!doc: The minimal numeric value of the slider, default: "0"

tabBarLocation.!doc: The placement of the tab titles. When set to "auto", the position is platform dependent. Can only be set in the create method. Supported values: "top", "bottom", "auto", default: "auto"

badge.!doc: Text of the tab badge on iOS.

image.!doc: Image shown on the tab button.

alignment.!doc: The horizontal alignment of the button text. Supported values: "left", "right", "center", default: "center"

image.!doc: An image to be displayed on the button.

selection.!doc: The selection state of the toggle button. Default: "false".

direction.!doc: Specifies the scrolling direction of the scroll composite. This property can only be set in the "tabris.create" method. It cannot be changed after widget creation. Supported values: "vertical", "horizontal", default: "vertical".

url.!doc: The URL of the video to play.

html.!doc: A complete HTML document to display. Always returns the last set value.

url.!doc: The URL of the web page to display. Returns empty string when content from "html" property is displayed.

pause.!doc: Fired before the application goes into hibernation.

resume.!doc: Fired after the application returned from hibernation.

backnavigation.!doc: Fired when the back button is pressed on Android. To suppress the default back navigation behavior, set "options.preventDefault" to "true". Parameters are: "app", "options".

change:activePage.!doc: Fired when the "activePage" property of tabris.ui changes.

change:orientation.!doc: Fired when the "orientation" property has changed and the rotation animation has finished.

select.!doc: Fired when the action is invoked. Gives the action as the first parameter.

animationstart.!doc: Fired when widget animation has been started.

animationend.!doc: Fired when widget animation has ended.

touchstart.!doc: Fired when a widget is touched.

touchmove.!doc: Fired repeatedly while swiping across the screen.

touchend.!doc: Fired when a touch ends on the same widget than it started on.

touchcancel.!doc: Fired instead of touchend when the touch ends on another widget than it started on.

longpress.!doc: Fired after pressing a widget for a specific amount of time (about a second).

resize.!doc: Fired when the widget's size has changed. You can use this event to apply new layoutData.

dispose.!doc: Fired when the widget is about to be disposed.

pan.!doc: Fired when a finger starts moving in the widget.

pan:left.!doc: Fired when a finger starts moving left in the widget.

pan:up.!doc: Fired when a finger starts moving up in the widget.

pan:right.!doc: Fired when a finger starts moving right in the widget.

pan:down.!doc: Fired when a finger starts moving down in the widget.

swipe:left.!doc: Fired when a finger moves left quickly.

swipe:up.!doc: Fired when a finger moves up quickly.

swipe:right.!doc: Fired when a finger moves right quickly.

swipe:down.!doc: Fired when a finger moves down quickly.

tap.!doc: Fired when a widget is tapped.

select.!doc: Fired when the button is pressed.  Gives the button as the first parameter.

change:selection.!doc: Fired when the check box is checked or unchecked.

select.!doc: Fired when the check box is checked or unchecked. Parameters are the same as in "change:selection", i.e. "widget", "selection", "options".

change:selection.!doc: Fired when the selection property changes. Parameters are: "widget", "selection", "options".

select.!doc: Fired when the switch is toggled by the user. Parameters are: "widget", "selection", "options".
Fired when a collection item is selected. Parameters are: "collectionView", "item", "{index: number}"

refresh.!doc: Fired when the user requested a refresh. An event listener should reset the "refreshIndicator" property when refresh is finished.

scroll.!doc: Fired while the collection view is scrolling. Parameters are: "collectionView", "event". The event contains the scroll delta of this scroll event: "{deltaX: number, deltaY: number}". The value of "deltaY" will be positive when scrolling up and negative when scrolling down.

addchild.!doc: Fired when a child is added. Parameters are: "collectionView", "child", "options"

removechild.!doc: Fired when a child is removed. Parameters are: "collectionView", "child", "{index: number}"

change:selection.!doc: Fired when the selection property changes.

select.!doc: Fired when the radio button is selected or deselected. Parameters are the same as in "change:selection", i.e. "widget", "selection", "options".

accept.!doc: Fired when a text input has been submitted by pressing the keyboard's search key. The current query text will be given as the second parameter.

input.!doc: Fired when the user inputs text. The current query text will be given as the second parameter.

change:selection.!doc: Fired when the selection property changes.

select.!doc: Fired when the selection property is changed by the user. Parameters are the same as in "change:selection", i.e. "widget", "selection", "options".

change:selection.!doc: Fired when the selection of the slider gets changed.

select.!doc: Fired when the selection property changes by user interaction. Parameters are the same as in "change:selection", i.e. "widget", "selection", "options".

accept.!doc: Fired when a text input has been finished by pressing the keyboard's Enter key. The label of this key may vary depending on the platform and locale. The second parameter contains the widgets text.

blur.!doc: Fired when the widget lost focus.

change:text.!doc: Fired when the text property changes, either by "set" or by the user.

focus.!doc: Fired when the widget gains focus.

input.!doc: Fired when the text changed by the user. Parameters are the same as in change:text, i.e. "widget", "text", "options".

change:selection.!doc: Fired when the selection property changes.

select.!doc: Fired when the toggle button is selected or deselected by the user. Parameters are the same as in "change:selection", i.e. "widget", "selection", "options".

appear.!doc: Fired when the page is about to become visible, i.e. it has become the active page.

resize.!doc: Fired when the page's size has changed. You can use this event to apply new layoutData.

disappear.!doc: Fired when the page is no longer visible, i.e. another page has become the active page.

change:selectionIndex.!doc: Fired when the selectionIndex property changes.

change:selection.!doc: Fired when the selection property changes. The index of the selected item is given in the options object as "index".

select.!doc: Fired when an item was selected by the user. Parameters are the same as in "change:selection", i.e. "widget", "selection", "options".

scroll.!doc: Fired on scrolling. Parameters: "widget", "{x: number, y: number}" (indicates the current scrolling position)

App.!doc: The object tabris.app provides information about the application.

reload.!doc: Forces the running application to reload the main module and start over.

installPatch.!doc: Installs a patch from the given URL. When the patch is successfully installed, it will remain inactive until the application is reloaded.

getResourceLocation.!doc: Returns the URL for a given resource that is bundled with the app. Can be used to access app resources like images, videos, etc. Note that these resources can only be accessed in read-only mode.

UI.!doc: The object "tabris.ui" is the root element for all widgets. This is the parent for all top-level pages, actions and the drawer.

Device.!doc: The object tabris.device provides information about the device that executes the application. All properties are read-only.

Action.!doc: An executable item that is integrated in the application's navigation menu. Add a listener on "select" to implement the action.

get.!doc: Gets the current value of the given property.

set.!doc: Sets the given property. Supports chaining.

on.!doc: Adds a listener to the list of functions to be notified when event is fired. Supports chaining.

once.!doc: Same as on, but removes the listener after it has been invoked by an event. Supports chaining.

off.!doc: Removes all occurrences of listener that are bound to event and context from this widget. Supports chaining.

apply.!doc: Applies the given properties to all descendants that match the associated selector(s). "properties" is an object in the format "{Selector: {property: value, property: value, ... }, Selector: ...}".

id.!doc: Direct access to the value of the property of the same name. May be used instead of "widget.get("id");" Do not use this field to change the value, instead use "widget.set("id", id);".

cid.!doc: An application-wide unique identifier automatically assigned to all widgets on creation. Do not change it.

type.!doc: The exact string that was used to create this widget using the "tabris.create" method.

animate.!doc:
Starts an animation that transforms the given properties from their current values to the given ones. 

Supported properties are "transform" and "opacity". 

Supported options are: 
 - "delay" (time until the animation starts in ms, defaults to "0") 
 - "duration" (in ms) 
 - "easing" (one of "linear", "ease-in", "ease-out", "ease-in-out") 
 - "repeat" (number of times to repeat the animation, defaults to "0") 
 - "reverse" ("true" to alternate the direction of the animation on every repeat) 
 - "name" (no effect, but will be given in animation events)

appendTo.!doc: Appends this widget to the given parent. The parent widget must support children (extending "Composite"). If the widget already has a parent, it is removed from the old parent.

insertBefore.!doc: Inserts this widget directly before the given widget. If the widget already has a parent, it is removed from the old parent.

insertAfter.!doc: Inserts this widget directly after the given widget. If the widget already has a parent, it is removed from the old parent.

parent.!doc: Returns the parent of this widget.

children.!doc: Returns a (possibly empty) collection of all children of this widget that match the selector.

trigger.!doc: Programmatically invokes all listeners for the given event type with a given set of parameters. Returns the widget itself.

dispose.!doc: Removes this widget from its parent and destroys it. Also disposes of all its children. Triggers a "remove" event on the parent and a "dispose" event on itself. The widget can no longer be used.

isDisposed.!doc: Returns "true" if the widget has been disposed, otherwise "false".

find.!doc: Returns a (possibly empty) collection of all descendants of this widget that match the selector.

WidgetCollection.!doc: A "WidgetCollection" is an array-like object representing a set of widgets, as returned by the widget methods "children" and "find".

children.!doc: Returns a collection containing all children of all widgets in this collection. Provided a "selector" argument, it is equivalent to "collection.children().filter(selector)".

find.!doc: Returns a collection containing all descendants of all widgets in this collection that match the given selector.

parent.!doc: Returns a collection containing all direct parents of all widgets in this collection.

appendTo.!doc: Append all widgets in this collection to the given widget.

animate.!doc: Animates all widgets in this collection.

dispose.!doc: Disposes all widgets in this collection.

first.!doc: Returns the first widget in the collection. Same as "collection[0]".

last.!doc: Returns the last widget in the collection. Same as "collection[collection.length - 1]".

toArray.!doc: Return an Array containing all widgets in the collection.

length.!doc: A read-only field containing the number of widgets in the collection.

forEach.!doc: Calls the given callback for each widget in the collection.

filter.!doc: Returns a new "WidgetCollection" containing all widgets in this collection that match the given selector.

indexOf.!doc: Returns the index of the given widget within the collection. If there is no match the return value is "-1".

open.!doc: Opens the page, i.e. makes it the active page.

close.!doc: Closes and disposes of the page.

Button.!doc: A push button. Can contain a text or an image.

TextView.!doc: A widget to display a text. For images, use ImageView.

TextInput.!doc: A widget that allows to enter text.

Switch.!doc: A switch widget that can be toggled.

CollectionView.!doc: A scrollable list that displays data items in cells, one per row. Cells are created on demand and filled with widgets in the "initializeCell" callback. When a data item is mapped to a cell, it is set as the property "item" and the cell receives an "change:item" event.

insert.!doc: Inserts the given items into this view. Items are added at the end. If "index" is present, inserts the given items into this view at the given index. If a negative index is given, it is interpreted as relative to the end. If the given index is greater than the item count, new items will be appended at the end. This operation will modify the items property.

remove.!doc: Removes the item at the given index from this view. If a negative index is given, it is interpreted as relative to the end. If "count" is present, removes count items beginning with the given index from this view. This operation will modify the items property.

refresh.!doc: Triggers a refresh of all visible items. This will issue itemchange events on the corresponding cells. If "index" is present, triggers a refresh of the item with the given index. If the item is scrolled into view, an itemchange event will be issued on the corresponding cell.

reveal.!doc: Scrolls the item with the given index into view. If a negative index is given, it is interpreted as relative to the end.

Picker.!doc: A widget with a drop-down list of items to choose from.

PageSelector.!doc: A CollectionView that contains all top-level pages and allows to open them. New top-level pages are added dynamically.

SearchAction.!doc: An action that displays a search text field with dynamic proposals when selected. Add a listener on "select" to implement the action. On "input", you may set a list of "proposals".

Composite.!doc: An empty widget that can contain other widgets.

append.!doc: Adds the given widget(s) in the given order to the composite.

Canvas.!doc: Canvas is a widget that can be used to draw graphics using a canvas context. Canvas context is a subset of the HTML5 "CanvasRenderingContext2D".

getContext.!type: fn(contextType: string, width: number, height: number) -> +types.CanvasContext
getContext.!doc: Returns the drawing context with the given size.

prototype.transform: fn(a: number, b: number, c: number, d: number, e: number, f: number)
prototype.setTransform: fn(a: number, b: number, c: number, d: number, e: number, f: number)
prototype.clearRect: fn(x: number, y: number, w: number, h: number)
prototype.fillRect: fn(x: number, y: number, w: number, h: number)
prototype.strokeRect: fn(x: number, y: number, w: number, h: number)
prototype.fillText: fn(text: string, x: number, y: number, maxWidth: number)
prototype.strokeText: fn(text: string, x: number, y: number, maxWidth: number)
prototype.quadraticCurveTo: fn(cpx: number, cpy: number, x: number, y: number)
prototype.bezierCurveTo: fn(cp1x: number, cp1y: number, cp2x: number, cp2y: number, x: number, y: number)
prototype.rect: fn(x: number, y: number, w: number, h: number)
prototype.arc: fn(x: number, y: number, radius: number, startAngle: number, endAngle: number, anticlockwise?: bool)

Drawer.!doc: A navigation drawer that can be swiped in from the left edge of the screen. Can contain any kind of widgets. It may be useful to include a "PageSelector" that displays all top-level pages.

ImageView.!doc: A widget to display an image.

ProgressBar.!doc: A widget representing a numeric value as a horizontal bar with a growing indicator.

RadioButton.!doc: A radio button. Selecting a radio button deselects all its siblings (i.e. all radio buttons within the same parent).

Slider.!doc: A widget representing a numeric value as an movable indicator on a horizontal line. Known Issues: Selection event is only fired after indicator is released.

TabFolder.!doc: A widget that can switch between tabs.

Tab.!doc: A container representing a single tab of the TabFolder widget.

ToggleButton.!doc: A push button that "snaps in", i.e. it is selected when pressed and deselected when pressed again.

ScrollView.!doc: A composite that allows its content to overflow either vertically (default) or horizontally. Children of a ScrollView may not be attached to its edge in scrolling direction (to the bottom for vertical scrolling, to the right for horizontal scrolling).

Video.!doc: A widget that plays a video from a URL.

WebView.!doc: A widget that can display a web page. Known Issues: Having multiple instances of this widget on screen may not work.

create.!doc: Creates a native widget of a given type and returns its reference.

setTimeout.!type: fn(callback: fn(), delay: number, args?: ?) -> number
setTimeout.!doc: Calls the given function with "args" (and all following parameters) after the specified delay. The actual delay may be slightly longer than the given one. Returns "timeoutID".

setInterval.!type: fn(callback: fn(), delay: number, args?: ?) -> number
setInterval.!doc: Calls the given function with "args" (and all following parameters) repeatedly, each time waiting the given delay. The actual delay may be slightly longer than the given one. Returns "intervalID".

clearTimeout.!doc: Cancels the running timeout associated with the given id. When given an invalid ID, nothing happens.

clearInterval.!doc: Cancels the running interval associated with the given id. When given an invalid ID, nothing happens.
